term.title: extrusion transformation

item.text: A transformation in which an atom or group Y connected to two other atoms or groups X and Z is lost from a molecule, leading to a product in which X is bonded to Z, e.g. [image: Not defined] or [image: Not defined] The reverse of an extrusion is called insertion.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1114 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)

term.citation: Citation: 'extrusion transformation' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.E02311

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
